notes.text:
An update for jenkins is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Jenkins is a continuous integration server that monitors executions of repeated jobs, such as building a software project or jobs run by cron.

Security Fix(es):

* jenkins: CSRF protection tokens did not expire (CVE-2019-10353)

* jenkins: Arbitrary file write vulnerability using file parameter definitions (CVE-2019-10352)

* jenkins: Unauthorized view fragment access (CVE-2019-10354)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 jenkins security update

full_product_name.name: jenkins-0:2.176.2.1563461785-1.el7.noarch as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1
jenkins-0:2.176.2.1563461785-1.el7.src as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1

cwe.name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')

notes.text: A path traversal vulnerability in Jenkins 2.185 and earlier, LTS 2.176.1 and earlier in core/src/main/java/hudson/model/FileParameterValue.java allowed attackers with Job/Configure permission to define a file parameter with a file name outside the intended directory, resulting in an arbitrary file write on the Jenkins master when scheduling a build.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jenkins: Arbitrary file write vulnerability using file parameter definitions (SECURITY-1424)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata

vulnerabilities.title: jenkins: Arbitrary file write vulnerability using file parameter definitions (SECURITY-1424)

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jenkins in weekly versions prior to 2.186 and LTS versions prior to 2.176.2. By default, CSRF tokens in Jenkins only checked user authentication and IP address which allowed attackers able to obtain a CSRF token for another user. This allowed an attacker to implement CSRF attacks as long as the victimâs IP address remained unchanged. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A vulnerability in the Stapler web framework used in Jenkins 2.185 and earlier, LTS 2.176.1 and earlier allowed attackers to access view fragments directly, bypassing permission checks and possibly obtain sensitive information.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
